headline: Brown & Brown (BRO): Net Profit Margin Decline Challenges Growth Narrative Despite Forecast-Beating Earnings
summary: Brown & Brown (BRO) delivered 17% annualized earnings growth over the past five years, and current forecasts call for an even sharper pace, at 18.2% per year. This is ahead of the broader US market’s 15.6%. Revenue is expected to rise by 17.2% per year, easily topping the US market average of 10.1%. However, net profit margin has slipped to 18.3% from last year’s 22.8%. While high-quality earnings continue to be recognized, negative growth in the past year adds a note of caution for investors...

headline: Compared to Estimates, Brown & Brown (BRO) Q3 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics
summary: Although the revenue and EPS for Brown & Brown (BRO) give a sense of how its business performed in the quarter ended September 2025, it might be worth considering how some key metrics compare with Wall Street estimates and the year-ago numbers.
